smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class ActivityRoot is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class FragmentViewDealer is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onCreate appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'ActivityRoot' with '31' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'EventList' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
File 'Db.kt' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'
File 'ExceptionExtensions.kt' with '20' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'
Class 'BundleOutput' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'BundleInput' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'IntentOutput' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'IntentInput' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function findLinkFragment is nested too deeply.
Function fillUi is nested too deeply.
Function glyphsFor is nested too deeply.
Function descriptionFor is nested too deeply.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface RootAPI is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface Db is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface HasDb is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

instances.message: This method is overloaded too many times.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionThrown
smells.description: Thrown exception is too generic. Prefer throwing project specific exceptions to handle error cases.

instances.message: Exception is a too generic Exception. Prefer throwing specific exceptions that indicate a specific error case.
Exception is a too generic Exception. Prefer throwing specific exceptions that indicate a specific error case.

smells.name: ThrowingExceptionsWithoutMessageOrCause
smells.description: A call to the default constructor of an exception was detected. Instead one of the constructor overloads should be called. This allows to provide more meaningful exceptions.

instances.message: A call to the default constructor of an exception was detected. Instead one of the constructor overloads should be called. This allows to provide more meaningful exceptions.

smells.name: ConstructorParameterNaming
smells.description: Constructor parameter names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Constructor private parameter names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

instances.message: The file name 'ImageService.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'imageService'.
The file name 'ObservablePreferences.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'ObservedProperty'.
The file name 'ApiService.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'apiService'.

smells.name: ClassNaming
smells.description: A classes name should fit the naming pattern defined in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Class and Object names should match the pattern: [A-Z$][a-zA-Z0-9$]*
Class and Object names should match the pattern: [A-Z$][a-zA-Z0-9$]*

smells.name: FunctionMinLength
smells.description: Function names should not be shorter than the minimum defined in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at least 3 characters long.
Function names should be at least 3 characters long.
Function names should be at least 3 characters long.

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class. This might result in confusion. Either rename the member or change it to a constructor.
A member is named after the class object. This might result in confusion. Please rename the member.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses around the lambda ({ navView }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ navView }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ navView }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (mode == ActionBarMode.MAP || mode == ActionBarMode.SEARCHMAP) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: mode == ActionBarMode.MAP || mode == ActionBarMode.SEARCHMAP
Parentheses in (db.images[mapRecord.imageId]) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: db.images[mapRecord.imageId]

Parentheses in (this.displayName.isNotEmpty() && this.displayName != this.attendeeNickname) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: this.displayName.isNotEmpty() && this.displayName != this.attendeeNickname
Parentheses in (AppPreferences.notificationMinutesBefore) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: AppPreferences.notificationMinutesBefore

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FragmentViewInfo.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of EventRecyclerFragment.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the package declaration and the list of imports.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FontAwesomeTextView.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of FragmentViewInfoGroups.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `InfoGroupFragment().withArguments("id" to it.id.toString()) to it.id.toString()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `if (isLeft) left else null to if (isRight) right else null`

smells.name: UtilityClassWithPublicConstructor
smells.description: The class declaration is unnecessary because it only contains utility functions. An object declaration should be used instead.

instances.message: The class SharingUtility only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.name: UnusedPrivateMember
smells.description: Private member is unused.

instances.message: Private function shouldBe is unused.
Private function shouldSatisfy is unused.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Joiner defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class AbstractDelta defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class ListenerSpec contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called bind
The data class ListenerSpec contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called provideDelegate
The data class ListenerSpecBinding contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called send
The data class ListenerSpecBinding contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called listen
The data class ListenerSpecBinding contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called unlisten
The data class ListenerSpecBinding contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called unlistenAll

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: VarCouldBeVal
smells.description: Var declaration could be val.

instances.message: Variable 'topics' could be val.

smells.name: TrailingWhitespace
smells.description: Checks which lines end with a whitespace.

instances.message: Line 20 ends with a whitespace.

smells.name: UnusedImports
smells.description: Unused Imports are dead code and should be removed.

instances.message: The import 'org.eurofurence.connavigator.pref.AuthPreferences' is unused.
